actions-list.actionItem: The Speaker announced that the House do now adjourn pursuant to clause 13 of Rule I and H. Res. 435. The next meeting is scheduled for 10:00 a.m. on May 23, 2025.

actions-list.header: DISTRICT WORK PERIOD
actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to clause 13 of Rule I, the Chair announced the Speaker's designation of the period from Thursday, May 22, 2025, through Monday, June 2, 2025, as a "district work period."

The House received a message from the Clerk. Pursuant to section 1(k) of House Resolution 895, One Hundred Tenth Congress, and section 4(d) of House Resolution 5, One Hundred Nineteenth Congress, the Clerk transmitted a notification that the following individuals each have signed an agreement not to be a candidate for the office of Senator or Representative in, or Delegate or Resident Commissioner to, the Congress for purposes of the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 until at least 3 years after they are no longer a member of the board or staff of the Office of Congressional Conduct: Karen L. Haas, Grace Liberman, Bill Luther, Lorraine C. Miller, Lynn A. Westmoreland, Omar Ashmawy, Indhira Benitez, Docktrel Cromartie, Kristina Crump, Helen Eisner, Jean-Paul Theroux, Peter Tilly, and Amber Venzon. Copies of the signed agreements will be retained by the Office of the Clerk.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 1969 — "To amend and reauthorize the Staff Sergeant Parker Gordon Fox Suicide Prevention Grant Program of the Department of Veterans Affairs."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 1701 — "To require the Secretary of Defense and the Secretary of State to monitor efforts by the People's Republic of China to build or buy strategic foreign ports, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 215
actions-list.actionItem: 214, 1 Present (Roll no. 145).

actions-list.header: On motion to recommit Failed by the Yeas and Nays: 212

actions-list.actionItem: The previous question on the motion to recommit was ordered pursuant to clause 2(b) of rule XIX.
Mrs. Trahan moved to recommit to the Committee on the Budget.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.

actions-list.header: DEBATE
actions-list.actionItem: The House proceeded with two hours of debate on H.R. 1.
Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 1. The resolution provides for consideration of H.R. 1 under a closed rule with two hours of general debate and one motion to recommit.
Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 436. H.R. 1 — "To provide for reconciliation pursuant to title II of H. Con. Res. 14."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection.
Considered as privileged matter. H. Res. 435 — "Expressing the profound sorrow of the House of Representatives on the death of the Honorable Gerald E. Connolly."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 216

actions-list.actionItem: Considered as unfinished business. S.J. Res. 31 — "Providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of the rule submitted by the Environmental Protection Agency relating to "Review of Final Rule Reclassification of Major Sources as Area Sources Under Section 112 of the Clean Air Act"."

actions-list.header: MOMENT OF SILENCE
actions-list.actionItem: The House observed a moment of silence in honor of the Honorable Gerald E. Connolly.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 217
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 213
DEBATE
actions-list.actionItem: The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 436.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On consideration of the resolution. Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 216
POINT OF ORDER
actions-list.actionItem: Mr. McGovern raised a point of order against the provisions of H. Res. 436 on the grounds that the resolution violates section 426(a) of the Congressional Budget Act. The Chair announced that the disposition of the point of order would be resolved by the question of consideration of H. Res. 436. The House proceeded with 20 minutes of debate on the point of order at the end of which the Chair will put the question on consideration as the statutory means of disposing of the point of order.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On consideration of the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 217
POINT OF ORDER
actions-list.actionItem: Mr. McGovern raised a point of order against the provisions of H. Res. 436 on the grounds that the resolution violates section 9(c) of the Congressional Budget Act. The Chair announced that the disposition of the point of order would be resolved by the question of consideration of H. Res. 436. The House proceeded with 20 minutes of debate on the point of order at the end of which the Chair will put the question on consideration of the resolution.
By direction of the Committee on Rules, Mrs. Houchin called up H. Res. 436 and asked for its immediate consideration.
Mrs. Houchin filed a report from the Committee on Rules on H. Res. 436.

actions-list.header: On motion to adjourn Failed by the Yeas and Nays: 211

actions-list.actionItem: Mr. Aguilar moved that the House do now adjourn.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of May 21.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.

actions-list.header: POSTPONED PROCEEDINGS
actions-list.actionItem: At the conclusion of debate on S.J. Res. 31, the Chair put the question on passage of the joint resolution and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Pallone demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.

actions-list.header: DEBATE
actions-list.actionItem: The House proceeded with one hour of debate on S.J. Res. 31.

Rule provides for consideration of S.J. Res. 13 and S.J. Res. 31. The resolution provides for consideration of S.J. Res. 13 and S.J. Res. 31 under a closed rule with one hour of general debate on each joint resolution. The resolution also provides for a motion to commit on both joint resolutions.

Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 426. S.J. Res. 31 — "Providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of the rule submitted by the Environmental Protection Agency relating to "Review of Final Rule Reclassification of Major Sources as Area Sources Under Section 112 of the Clean Air Act"."

actions-list.header: Board of Trustees of Gallaudet University
actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to 20 U.S.C. 4303, and the order of the House of January 3, 2025, the Speaker appointed the following members of the House to the Board of Trustees of Gallaudet University: Mr. Owens and Ms. McCollum.

actions-list.header: Board of Trustees of the Institute of American Indian and Alaska Native Culture and Arts Development
actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to 20 U.S.C. 4412, and the order of the House of January 3, 2025, the Speaker appointed the following members of the House to the Board of Trustees of the Institute of American Indian and Alaska Native Culture and Arts Development: Mr. Cole and Ms. Leger Fernandez.

actions-list.header: ONE MINUTE SPEECHES
actions-list.actionItem: The House proceeded with one minute speeches which by direction of the Chair, would be limited to 15 per side of the aisle.

actions-list.header: ADJUSTMENT OF THE WHOLE NUMBER OF THE HOUSE
actions-list.actionItem: Under clause 5(d) of rule XX, the Chair announced to the House that, in light of the passing of the gentleman from Virginia, Mr. Connolly, the whole number of the House is 432.

actions-list.header: PLEDGE OF ALLEGIANCE
actions-list.actionItem: The Chair designated Ms. Houlahan to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of May 21.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 12:00 P.M. today.

actions-list.header: MORNING-HOUR DEBATE
actions-list.actionItem: The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 12:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Darin LaHood to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
